botanical_details.potentially_harmful: All parts may cause severe discomfort if eaten. Wear gloves and wash hands after handling
botanical_details.genus: Wisteria are vigorous woody climbers with twining stems bearing pinnate leaves and long pendulous racemes of fragrant pea-like flowers in spring and early summer

how_to_grow.cultivation: Can be grown informally through large tree or trained against a house wall. Will grow in most soils that are moist but well-drained in sun or part shade. See wisteria cultivation for more advice
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by layering in spring, softwood cuttings from late spring to early summer, hardwood cuttings in winter, root cuttings in late winter or grafting in late winter
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to aphids, glasshouse red spider mite, brown scale and wisteria scale
how_to_grow.diseases: May be susceptible to wisteria graft failure, Powdery mildews, honey fungus, phytophthora root rot, fungal leaf spot, virus diseases and early flower buds can be susceptible to frost damage
